name: 黃如瑩
objective: Contemporary popular fiction explores an array of intriguing issues concerning the ongoing of human society/culture and provides the best materials for language learning and cultural literacy. For each novel, we will read a selection of the text and then engage in the discussions about the main theme to cultivate our critical thinking.
schedule:
Syllabus 課程表:
Week 1: Introduction, the Best Offer 
Theme One: Going through the labyrinth 
Week 2: The Giver  by Lois Lowry 
Week 3: The Maze Runner  by James Dashner
Week 4: The Hunger Games  by Suzanne Collins
Week 5: The City of Amber  by Jeanne DuPrau
Theme Two: Solving the Mystery  
Week 6: Sherlock Holmes and John Watson  by Authur Conan Doyle
Week 7: The Girl with the Dragon Tatoos  by Stieg Larsson
Week 8: The Girl with the Pearl Earring by Tracy Chevalier
Week 9 (Mid-term exam week): Gone Girl  by Gillian Flynn
Theme Three:  Looking for the Self 
Week 10: The Perks of Being a Wallflower  by Stephen Chbosky
Week 11: The Help  by Kathryn Stockett
Week 12: Alice in the Wonderland by C. S. Lewis
Week 13: The Golden Compass by Philip Pullman
Week 14: The Kite Runner  by Khaled Hosseini
Theme Four: Love and Passion
Week 15: Stardust  by Neil Gaiman
Week 16: The Book Thief  by Markus Zusak
Week 17:  The Time Traveler's Wife  by Audrey Niffenegger
Week 18 (Final examination week): Wrapping up
scorePolicy:
1.	Weekly attendance: 45%
2.	Participation in classroom discussions: 20%
3.	Oral presentation: 15%
4.	Final project presentation, 7-10 pages: 20%
materials:
1. Good Chats (3rd edition),by Sandsberry, Sorenson, and Ring. Taipei: Bookman, 2008.
2. Essential Idioms in English (New Edition), by Dixson. New York: Pearson Education, 1994.
3. Dictionary of Idioms, by Terban.  New York:  Scholastic, 1996.
4.Idioms Made Easy:  Stories of Selected English Idioms. By Tseng and Kao. Taipei: Bookman, 2004.
